original: Brolin, John Axel Hugo, överläkare, Styr SÖ, f. 20/5/00’ i Söderhamn av Carl B. o. Hulda Andersson. G. 30 m. Marianne Lindahl. Barn: Jan f. 35, Ulf 37. — Stud:ex. 20, med. kand. 23 o. med. lic. 29 i Sthlm. Assist, v. Bie badanst. 21 o. 22, friv. assist, isamt tf. aman. v. Karol. inst. ortoped. klin. 27-29, tf. bitr. läk. v. Seraf :las. gymn:-avd. tre mån. 27-28, andre und:läk. v. Kronpr. Victorias kustsan. 29-30, tf. andre und :läk. v. Växjö las. 30, assist :läk. v. Varbergs las. 30-31, und:-läk. där 31, v. Vanföreanst. i Gbg 31-33, förste und :läk. v. Kronpr. Victorias kustsan. 33-35, assist :läk. o. tf. und:läk. v. Hälsingb. las. kir. avd. 35-36, överläk. v. Styrsö kustsan. sed. 36. Stud. sjukv :inrättn. i Engl., Belg., Spän. m. fl. eur. länder 24-26.
translated: Brolin, John Axel Hugo, senior physician, Styrsö County Hospital, born on May 20th, 1900 in Söderhamn to Carl B. and Hulda Andersson. Married to Marianne Lindahl in 1930. Children: Jan, born in 1935, Ulf, born in 1937. He completed his high school studies in 1920, his Bachelor of Medicine in 1923, and his Medical License in 1929 in Stockholm. He worked as an assistant at Bie Bathhouse in 1921 and 1922, as a voluntary assistant as well as temporary assistant professor at the Karolinska Institute's Orthopedic Clinic from 1927 to 1929, a temporary assistant physician at Seraf:las. Gymnastics Department for three months in 1927-1928, a second assistant physician at Kronpr. Victoria's coastal hospital in 1929-1930, a temporary second assistant physician at Växjö Hospital in 1930, an assistant physician at Varberg Hospital in 1930-1931, a physician there in 1931, at the Disabled person's institution in Gothenburg from 1931 to 1933, first physician at Kronpr. Victoria's coastal hospital in 1933-1935, assistant physician and temporary physician at the surgical department of Hälsingborg Hospital in 1935-1936, and senior physician at the Styrsö coastal hospital since 1936. He studied medical institutions in England, Belgium, Spain, and other European countries from 1924 to 1926.

memberOf.name: Karolinska Institute's Orthopedic Clinic
